blog.name: sailorsaigas
blog.title: Sailor Saigas Contemplates
blog.description: Transwoman, Lesbian, She/Her, 30. Author of "For Want of a Notebook." Here, I list my personal observations, opinions and theories on the characters and stories of fictional media (from anime, to books, cartoons, comics, film, television, and video games).

summary: I am absolutely loving For Want of a Notebook. I was just wondering if this was going to be a fic where izuku gets ofa or not...
question: I am absolutely loving For Want of a Notebook. I was just wondering if this was going to be a fic where izuku gets ofa or not because i think that would be interesting to see how his relationship with momo changes because of that but it would also be neat to see him get in through general studies. Either way I’m looking forward to seeing what you do with this fic.
answer:
He will indeed still be getting One for All in this story. What he happens to do with it, and how it affects him and Momo, will remain to be seen. ;)

Thank you so much for reading! ^_^

reblog.comment:
He will indeed still be getting One for All in this story. What he happens to do with it, and how it affects him and Momo, will remain to be seen. ;)

Thank you so much for reading! ^_^

trail.content_raw:
He will indeed still be getting One for All in this story. What he happens to do with it, and how it affects him and Momo, will remain to be seen. ;)

Thank you so much for reading! ^_^

blog.name: andanete
blog.title: she
blog.description: a fan but mainly of bucky barnes

body:
kiribaku drabble

rough, calloused hands wring together int a fit of anxiety. nervous, cold sweat clams and gathers in his palms; the feeling of it becomes a hard, hard reminder of what was to come.

of what he’s bout to do.


there are, in the long years he’s known bakugou, very few times that he’s ever felt so nervous with him. once had been the first time he saw him fight, back to the second day of Yuuei. the rest had been times he felt concerned for him, not of him. anxiety is not an emotion he would associate with his relationship with bakugou.

he should feel apprehensive, maybe even a little fearful of bakugou. even their friends, despite the time they’ve spent knowing bakugou, still tense up a little whenever he gets a little too heated in his anger.

he never did. not once after that day. ever since, he finds himself at ease with bakugou each day he spent with him. everything he did and said and do and say felt natural, felt good—there were hardly any repurcussions from bakugou (perhaps a couple of physical ones but he’s the Red Riot, he can take a couple of hits).

“shit, shitty hair, what do hell are you looking at?”


“you,” he says easily despite the degrading nickname and his smile widens at the growing pink of bakugou’s ears. he dodges the swipe at him. “can i ask you something?”

“already did, shithead.”


he chuckles, bakugou’s mean tone sliding over him like water over rock. he’s anxious, not of what he’s about to say, not really. more like he’s scared of what bakugou would say in response. he’s unsure of his next reply would slide as easily as the rest of them.

“wipe that damn look off your face and cough it out, shitty hair.”


“bakugou, would you—”
